intro: Solanum tuberosum f. wila-huaycku, commonly known as the Huaycán potato, is a botanical variant of the common potato. It is characterized by its unique tuber morphology, which includes elongated shapes and varying skin colors. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is native to the Andean regions of South America. Its tubers are typically smaller than those of the common potato and have a distinct flavor profile. This variety is valued for its adaptability to high-altitude growing conditions and its use in traditional Andean cuisine.
